intro: Semenovia thomsonii, commonly known as Thomson's semenovia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Semenovia thomsonii is considered a species of conservation concern.
